result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tammy Lee Pulvermacher

records.addlTxt: Return on warrant on November 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:41 AM Defendant Tammy Lee Pulvermacher not in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Tammy Lee Pulvermacher.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hayes has no record to make regarding DE's non-appearance.  State requests a warrant.  State notes the officer was present today.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.

1:27 PM Defendant Tammy Lee Pulvermacher in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Tammy Lee Pulvermacher.  Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hayes requests a preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Absolute Sobriety and no possession of any controlled substances w/o a valid Rx

3:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tammy Lee Pulvermacher appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes appeared by video for Tammy Lee Pulvermacher.  Court states case and appearances.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  State makes bail argument.  Atty Hayes responds.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety and no possession of any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Return date scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on August 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 29, 2022 at 11:45 am.
